pages.text: Storage comes in all shapes and sizes. There are many options, from simple to complex. For example, you can start with a basic vanilla chest and upgrade it through $(6)Iron Chests$() to a 9x12 chest!
Iron chests can be crafted directly, or upgraded at will. They come in Copper, Iron, Silver, Gold, Diamond, Crystal, and Obsidian variations. There also are shulker box options.
$(l)PORTABLE STORAGE$()$(p)There are many ways you can carry your stuff around with you.
Cyclic storage bags hold a lot AND you can pick it's color.
Thermal Expansion satchels are upgradeable and there is a void options as well.
Ender Utilities Handy Bags come in regular and large sizes and take memory cards to expand how much they can hold.
$(l)ULTRA EFFICIENT STORAGE$()$(p)Want to hold a LOT of stuff in tiny space? We got you, boo.
With a tier 3 card, the RF Tools Modular Storage can hold up to 300 stacks of an item.

Handy Chests are extremely powerful! Through the use of memory cards they can hold up to 4096 items $(l)per slot$(), and each chest can hold up to 4 memory cards. If you connect these chests to a storage network system (such as Simple Storage Network), the system will only read the one memory card that is active and will ignore the others.

If you have loads of items that typically don't stack (armor, weapons, enchanted books, etc) toss 'em in a Junk Drawer! Not only does it have 270 slots of storage space, it will stack up to 256 non-stackable items. I could have sworn I put some spare AA batteries in here...

If you need absolute control over what items are stored in a chest, the Adjustable Storage Unit is here to the rescue!  You can choose the number of slots, the max stack amount, and even lock each slot to a specific item for filter purposes. It's the perfect chest for storing specific crafting ingredients for automation, etc.

For those times when you need to store a ridiculous amount of a single item, there are Barrels and Massive Storage Units, which can be configured to store up to a nearly infinite amount. Why you feel the need to store Brazilian items is beyond me...but hey, if you wanna be a dang sicko hoarder I can't stop ya!
